00034 void VectorPower(arma::vec& vec, double power)
00035 {
00036   for (size_t i = 0; i < vec.n_elem; i++)
00037   {
00038     if (std::abs(vec(i)) > 1e-12)
00039       vec(i) = (vec(i) > 0) ? std::pow(vec(i), (double) power) :
00040           -std::pow(-vec(i), (double) power);
00041     else
00042       vec(i) = 0;
00043   }
00044 }
00045 
00053 void Center(const arma::mat& x, arma::mat& xCentered)
00054 {
00055   // Sum matrix along dimension 0 (that is, sum elements in each row).
00056   arma::vec rowVectorSum = arma::sum(x, 1);
00057   rowVectorSum /= x.n_cols; // scale
00058 
00059   xCentered.set_size(x.n_rows, x.n_cols);
00060   for (size_t i = 0; i < x.n_rows; i++)
00061     xCentered.row(i) = x.row(i) - rowVectorSum(i);
00062 }

00069 void WhitenUsingSVD(const arma::mat& x,
00070                     arma::mat& xWhitened,
00071                     arma::mat& whiteningMatrix)
00072 {
00073   arma::mat covX, u, v, invSMatrix, temp1;
00074   arma::vec sVector;
00075 
00076   covX = ccov(x);
00077 
00078   svd(u, sVector, v, covX);
00079 
00080   size_t d = sVector.n_elem;
00081   invSMatrix.zeros(d, d);
00082   invSMatrix.diag() = 1 / sqrt(sVector);
00083 
00084   whiteningMatrix = v * invSMatrix * trans(u);
00085 
00086   xWhitened = whiteningMatrix * x;
00087 }
00088 
00094 void WhitenUsingEig(const arma::mat& x,
00095                     arma::mat& xWhitened,
00096                     arma::mat& whiteningMatrix)
00097 {
00098   arma::mat diag, eigenvectors;
00099   arma::vec eigenvalues;
00100 
00101   // Get eigenvectors of covariance of input matrix.
00102   eig_sym(eigenvalues, eigenvectors, ccov(x));
00103 
00104   // Generate diagonal matrix using 1 / sqrt(eigenvalues) for each value.
00105   VectorPower(eigenvalues, -0.5);
00106   diag.zeros(eigenvalues.n_elem, eigenvalues.n_elem);
00107   diag.diag() = eigenvalues;
00108 
00109   // Our whitening matrix is diag(1 / sqrt(eigenvectors)) * eigenvalues.
00110   whiteningMatrix = diag * trans(eigenvectors);
00111 
00112   // Now apply the whitening matrix.
00113   xWhitened = whiteningMatrix * x;
00114 }
00115 
00119 void RandVector(arma::vec &v)
00120 {
00121   v.zeros();
00122 
00123   for (size_t i = 0; i + 1 < v.n_elem; i += 2)
00124   {
00125     double a = drand48();
00126     double b = drand48();
00127     double first_term = sqrt(-2 * log(a));
00128     double second_term = 2 * M_PI * b;
00129     v[i]     = first_term * cos(second_term);
00130     v[i + 1] = first_term * sin(second_term);
00131   }
00132 
00133   if ((v.n_elem % 2) == 1)
00134   {
00135     v[v.n_elem - 1] = sqrt(-2 * log(drand48())) * cos(2 * M_PI * drand48());
00136   }
00137 
00138   v /= sqrt(dot(v, v));
00139 }
00140 
00145 void Orthogonalize(const arma::mat& x, arma::mat& W)
00146 {
00147   // For a matrix A, A^N = V * D^N * V', where VDV' is the
00148   // eigendecomposition of the matrix A.
00149   arma::mat eigenvalues, eigenvectors;
00150   arma::vec egval;
00151   eig_sym(egval, eigenvectors, ccov(x));
00152   VectorPower(egval, -0.5);
00153 
00154   eigenvalues.zeros(egval.n_elem, egval.n_elem);
00155   eigenvalues.diag() = egval;
00156 
00157   arma::mat at = (eigenvectors * eigenvalues * trans(eigenvectors));
00158 
00159   W = at * x;
00160 }
00161 
00166 void Orthogonalize(arma::mat& x)
00167 {
00168   Orthogonalize(x, x);
00169 }
